channel.title: Problem after disabling ACPI in Whonix VMs
channel.description:
Hello. After disabling ACPI as it was written in whonix guide i encountered many errors at start: Failed to start: user login management secure distributed web date - pre boot clock randomization whonix legacy versions fixes whonix firewall loader raise network interfaces anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor permit user sessions ram adjusted desktop starter load kernel module drm
My host system is debian bullseye. Has anyone encountered such a problem?

item.title: Problem after disabling ACPI in Whonix VMs
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Zzak0:

disabling ACPI as it was written in whonix guide

Read where? Here…?

Kicksecure – 16 Feb 22

Virtualization Platform Security

Deciding on a Virtualization Platform and Configuration, VirtualBox Hardening

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

Zzak0:

Failed to start:

I cannot reproduce this. Probably unrelated to ACPI.

For users:
Point on ACPI in documentation was outdated. Updated just now. Therefore point on ACPI is now moot.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem after disabling ACPI in Whonix VMs

item.title: Problem after disabling ACPI in Whonix VMs
item.dc:creator: Zzak0
item.description:
Hello.
After disabling ACPI as it was written in whonix guide i encountered many errors at start:
Failed to start:
user login management
secure distributed web date - pre
boot clock randomization
whonix legacy versions fixes
whonix firewall loader
raise network interfaces
anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor
permit user sessions
ram adjusted desktop starter
load kernel module drm

My host system is debian bullseye.
Has anyone encountered such a problem?

Read full topic
